intro: Rhinanthus mediterraneus subsp. behrendsenii, commonly known as the Mediterranean yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its hemiparasitic relationship with grasses, drawing nutrients from its host plants. The plant produces vibrant orange to yellow flowers, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct ecological and morphological characteristics compared to other rhinanthus species.
